problem.p: If the height of the column in problem 1 is reduced to 2.5m, what is the buckling load?

choicegroup.label: If the height of the column in problem 1 is reduced to 2.5m, what is the buckling load?

div.p: Decreasing the height results in an increase in the buckling load; thus, the column is able to support a higher load. Shorter columns typically support more load.
